intro: Silene myloptera, commonly known as the woolly catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Silene myloptera is an annual or biennial plant, depending on the climate, and is known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
